title: Rajan drives North 35 km. He then turns right and travels 2km and then turns right and drives another 25km. How far does he have to travel to get back to the starting point? - Quora

response.answer_text: Answer: Rajan need to travel 10.198 Kms if there is a diagonal road or 12 Kms He travelled 35 Kms towards North and turned right towards East travelled 2 Kms then turned towards South travelled 25 Kms Now. Rajan on parallel road of 2 Kms apart at point 10 kms ( 35 -25 = 10) away from starting point This forms a right angle of sides 10 Km and 2 Km and hypotenuse Hypotenuse is Square Root of ( 10^2 + 2^2) =Square Root of (104)=10.198 Kms Hence, Route 1: Rajan need to travel 10.198 Kms if there diagonal road Route 2: Turn Right towards West travel 2 Kms joins original route turns left towards South and travels 10 Kms to reach starting Point. So, the total travelling distance is 12 Kms
